columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the best option using the concept of present value of growth opportunity.

Doing an MBA and staying to work full-time are both investment opportunities in this situation. The present value of growth opportunity is a quantifiable value of an investment's growth. It can be solved using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of growth opportunity}&=\dfrac{\text{Salary}}{\text{Return rate}-\text{Growth rate}} \times 1- \left(\dfrac{1+\text{Growth rate}}{1+\text{Return rate}}\right)^\text{Time}\\
&\times (1-\text{Tax rate})
\end{aligned}$$

Solving for the present value of growth opportunity for the MBA at Wilton University, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of growth opportunity}&=\dfrac{\$87,000}{0.055-0.04}\times1-\left(\dfrac{1+0.04}{1+0.055}\right)^{36}\\
&\times(1-0.31)\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,612,050.35
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of growth opportunity for this is $\$1,612,050.35$

Aside from this, we will also solve for the cost for the $2$ years of studying by adding the tuition fees and all the costs, then doing the same but dividing it by 1 plus the discount rate. The cost for the MBA at Wilton University is:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cost}&=(\$58,000+\$2,000+\$3,000)\\
&+\dfrac{\$58,000+\$2,000+\$3,000}{1+0.055}\\[15 pt]
&=\$122,715.64
\end{aligned}$$

The cost of studying at this university is $\$122,715.64$

We will then take the cost, then subtract it from the present value growth opportunity of attending the MBA at Wilton University:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value}&=\$1,612,050.35-\$122,715.64\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,489,334.71
\end{aligned}$$

The value that we will get from taking an MBA at Wilton University is $\$1,489,334.71$

We will do the same process for Mount Perry College:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of growth opportunity}&=\dfrac{\$78,000}{0.055-0.035}\times1-\left(\dfrac{1+0.035}{1+0.055}\right)^{37}\\
&\times(1-0.29)\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,405,123.99
\end{aligned}$$

The present value of growth opportunity for this is $\$1,405,123.99$

For the cost, since it will only take one year, then we will simply add the tuition fee and all the other costs.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cost}&=\$75,000+\$4,200+\$3,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$82,200
\end{aligned}$$

The cost of studying at Mount Perry College is $\$82,200$

We will then take the cost, then subtract it from the present value growth opportunity of attending the MBA at Mount Perry College:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value}&=\$1,405,123.99-\$82,200\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,322,923.99
\end{aligned}$$

The value that we will get from taking an MBA at Mount Perry College is $\$1,322,923.99$

Now for the present value of just staying as a full time worker, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of growth opportunity}&=\dfrac{\$53,000}{0.055-0.03}\times1-\left(\dfrac{1+0.03}{1+0.055}\right)^{38}\\
&\times(1-0.26)\\[15 pt]
&=\$938,149.63
\end{aligned}$$

The value that we will get from foregoing the MBA is $\$938,149.63$
Based on the calculated values, taking an MBA at Wilton University provides the highest value and it should be the right choice.
